title: Ukraine Says Russia Launched 67 Drones In Massive Overnight Attack
content: Ukraine's air force said today that Russia launched a total of 67 long-range Shahed drones in a mass overnight attack, 58 of which it was able to shoot down.
summary: Ukraine's air force said today that Russia launched a total of 67 long-range Shahed drones in a mass overnight attack, 58 of which it was able to shoot down.

title: 24-Year-Old Satellite To Burn Up Over Pacific Ocean On Earth Re-Entry
content: After 24 years diligently studying Earth's magnetic field, a satellite will mostly burn up over the Pacific Ocean on Sunday during a "targeted" re-entry into the atmosphere, in a first for the European Space Agency as it seeks to reduce space debris.
summary: After 24 years diligently studying Earth's magnetic field, a satellite will mostly burn up over the Pacific Ocean on Sunday during a "targeted" re-entry into the atmosphere, in a first for the European Space Agency as it seeks to reduce space debris.

title: Video: Ukraine's 'Dragon Drone' Rains Molten Metal On Russian Positions
content: Fire rained on Russian-held positions in the occupied Kharkiv region when Ukrainian drones dropped thermite incendiary bombs, burning trees and reportedly some Russian military vehicles.
summary: Fire rained on Russian-held positions in the occupied Kharkiv region when Ukrainian drones dropped thermite incendiary bombs, burning trees and reportedly some Russian military vehicles.

title: How A Taxi Driver In El Salvador Got Rich With Bitcoin
content: Napoleon Osorio is proud of being the first taxi driver to have accepted payment in bitcoin in the first country in the world to make the cryptocurrency legal tender: El Salvador.
summary: Napoleon Osorio is proud of being the first taxi driver to have accepted payment in bitcoin in the first country in the world to make the cryptocurrency legal tender: El Salvador.

title: Explained: Where Donald Trump's Criminal Trials Stand Ahead Of US Polls
content: The year 2024 was set to be a judicial minefield for Donald Trump, with some thinking the former president could be behind bars before the November 5 presidential election.
summary: The year 2024 was set to be a judicial minefield for Donald Trump, with some thinking the former president could be behind bars before the November 5 presidential election.

title: "Russian Spy" Beluga Whale Had Multiple Bullet Wounds: Animal Rights Group
content: Nicknamed 'Hvaldimir,' the beluga whale became popular in Norway after the unusual harness on it sparked speculations that it was trained as a spy by Russia.
summary: Nicknamed 'Hvaldimir,' the beluga whale became popular in Norway after the unusual harness on it sparked speculations that it was trained as a spy by Russia.

title: Prince Hisahito Becomes Japan's 1st Royal Male To Turn 18 In 40 Years
content: Prince Hisahito, the son of Crown Prince Akishino, turned 18 on Friday and joined the Imperial family as an adult. With this, Hisahito became the first male member of the family to reach adulthood in 39 years, reported Japan Times.
summary: Prince Hisahito, the son of Crown Prince Akishino, turned 18 on Friday and joined the Imperial family as an adult. With this, Hisahito became the first male member of the family to reach adulthood in 39 years, reported Japan Times.

title: Weaponising "Joy": How Kamala Harris Plans To Beat Trump At His Own Game
content: US presidential hopeful Kamala Harris appears to be taking a leaf out of rival Donald Trump's playbook by focusing on evoking emotion, rather than explaining policy, on the campaign trail -- and she's hoping her appeal to "joy" will help her beat him
summary: US presidential hopeful Kamala Harris appears to be taking a leaf out of rival Donald Trump's playbook by focusing on evoking emotion, rather than explaining policy, on the campaign trail -- and she's hoping her appeal to "joy" will help her beat him

title: China Stops Foreign Adoptions Of Its Children After 3 Decades
content: China will no longer send children overseas for adoption, the government said, overturning a more than three-decade rule that was rooted in its once strict one-child policy.
summary: China will no longer send children overseas for adoption, the government said, overturning a more than three-decade rule that was rooted in its once strict one-child policy.

title: Explained: Why Helium Leaks Delayed Boeing Starliner Astronauts' Return
content: Two NASA astronauts aboard Boeing's Starliner will stay on the International Space Station for months because of a faulty propulsion system whose problems included helium leaks.
summary: Two NASA astronauts aboard Boeing's Starliner will stay on the International Space Station for months because of a faulty propulsion system whose problems included helium leaks.

title: Boeing's Starliner Spaceship Returns To Earth Without Astronauts
content: Boeing's beleaguered Starliner returned to Earth from the International Space Station (ISS) without astronauts Sunita Williams and Barry E Wilmore.
summary: Boeing's beleaguered Starliner returned to Earth from the International Space Station (ISS) without astronauts Sunita Williams and Barry E Wilmore.

title: "Don't Take Arms Against...": US Military's Tinder Ad In Lebanon Goes Viral
content: An advertisement warning that the US was ready to deploy its F-16 fighter jets to protect its allies in the face of Iranian threats appeared on the dating app Tinder in Lebanon.
summary: An advertisement warning that the US was ready to deploy its F-16 fighter jets to protect its allies in the face of Iranian threats appeared on the dating app Tinder in Lebanon.

title: Kamala Harris' Husband Says He's Never Won A Debate Against Her
content: Ahead of the highly-anticipated first Presidential debate next week, Kamala Harris' husband, Doug Emhoff, spoke about their debates as a married couple in a new interview with 'Pod Save America'.
summary: Ahead of the highly-anticipated first Presidential debate next week, Kamala Harris' husband, Doug Emhoff, spoke about their debates as a married couple in a new interview with 'Pod Save America'.

title: Study Explains How Traffic Noise, Pollution Are Linked To Infertility
content: Roughly one in six people are affected by infertility worldwide. And with more than half the worlds population now living in urban areas, researchers are interested in whether living in noisy and polluted cities could be to blame.
summary: Roughly one in six people are affected by infertility worldwide. And with more than half the worlds population now living in urban areas, researchers are interested in whether living in noisy and polluted cities could be to blame.

title: US Teen Shooter's Mother Was Arrested Regularly, Locked Him Out Of Home
content: The 14-year-old Georgia boy who opened fire at a classroom in his school, killing two students and two teachers, was raised in a troubled home, family and neighbours have said.
summary: The 14-year-old Georgia boy who opened fire at a classroom in his school, killing two students and two teachers, was raised in a troubled home, family and neighbours have said.

title: Selena Gomez, 32, Is Now A Billionaire. Her Net Worth Is...
content: American actress, singer and entrepreneur Selena Gomez is now a billionaire, according to Bloomberg, which values her net worth at $1.3 billion.
summary: American actress, singer and entrepreneur Selena Gomez is now a billionaire, according to Bloomberg, which values her net worth at $1.3 billion.

title: Cat Rescuers Cause Three-Vehicle Crash In US, Fail To Catch Kitten
content: Two animal lovers who stopped on a US freeway to rescue a stranded kitten caused a three-vehicle crash -- and then lost the cat they were trying to help.
summary: Two animal lovers who stopped on a US freeway to rescue a stranded kitten caused a three-vehicle crash -- and then lost the cat they were trying to help.

title: Boeing's Troubled Starliner Leaves Space Station Without Its Astronauts
content: Boeing's beleaguered Starliner left the International Space Station (ISS) on Friday, bound for Earth without the astronauts who rode up on the spaceship after NASA deemed the risk too great.
summary: Boeing's beleaguered Starliner left the International Space Station (ISS) on Friday, bound for Earth without the astronauts who rode up on the spaceship after NASA deemed the risk too great.

title: Pak National Arrested From Canada For Plotting Terrorist Attack In New York
content: The 20-year-old arrested accused, Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, allegedly planned a terrorist attack in New York City around October 7.
summary: The 20-year-old arrested accused, Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, allegedly planned a terrorist attack in New York City around October 7.

title: Turkish-American Woman "Shot In The Head" After Israeli Forces Open Fire
content: A Turkish-American woman was shot dead Friday while demonstrating against Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank town of Beita, where the army acknowledged opening fire.
summary: A Turkish-American woman was shot dead Friday while demonstrating against Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank town of Beita, where the army acknowledged opening fire.
